title: Of Christ alone without Sin
text: Christ in the truth of our nature was made like unto us in all things, sin only excepted ... and to be a sacrifice, not only for original guilt, but also for actual sins of men.
commentary: Article 15, “Of Christ alone without Sin”, states: Christ in the truth of our nature was made like unto us in all things, sin only excepted . The commentary below is a concise study essay offering historical context, theological significance, and suggestions for further study. Historically this Article reflects the Reformation effort to retain the catholic tradition where it is scriptural while rejecting practices viewed as unscriptural. For modern readers, note how this Article shapes worship, preaching, and ethical teaching, and compare it with patristic sources and later Anglican commentators.
